title: Saliency-based object counting and localization
abstract: Methods, systems, and computer programs are presented for adding new features to a network service. An example method includes accessing an image from a user device to determine a salient object count of a plurality of objects in the image. A salient object count of the plurality of objects in the image is determined. An indicator of the salient object count of the plurality of objects in the image is caused to be displayed on the user device.
claims:
1. A method, comprising:
generating, via hardware processing circuitry, a plurality of conditional maps for an image via applying a plurality of filters to the image, wherein each filter corresponds to a respective object category;
generating, via the hardware processing circuitry, a heat map for the image based at least in part on the plurality of conditional maps, the heat map depicting a plurality of probability regions indicating locations of one or more salient objects in the image;
determining, via the hardware processing circuitry, a count of a plurality of objects in the image, the count based on the plurality of probability regions exceeding a threshold confidence score; and
causing display, on a device, of an indication of the count of the plurality of objects.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein the plurality of probability regions are also determined based on a convolutional neural network.
3. The method of claim 1, wherein the count is determined by a neural network trained to count objects in images.
4. The method of claim 1, wherein at least one bounding box is applied to at least one of the plurality of probability regions.
5. The method of claim 1, wherein the plurality of probability regions comprise a plurality of peak probability regions.
6. The method of claim 5, wherein the determining of the count is based on the plurality of peak probability regions.
7. The method of claim 5, further comprising defining bounding polygons determining portions of the image corresponding to the plurality of peak probability regions, wherein the determining of the count is based on the bounding polygons.
8. The method of claim 5, further comprising counting a total number of the plurality of peak probability regions, wherein the count is based on the total number.
9. The method of claim 8, further comprising iteratively performing the determining of the count for a sequence of video frames.
10. The method of claim 1, wherein generating the plurality of conditional maps for the image comprises processing the image via a first convolutional layer comprising the plurality of filters, and wherein generating the heat map comprises summarizing the plurality of conditional maps via applying a second convolutional layer comprising a second filter.
